quotes.quote: Well, I started out laughing and thinking this was a troll thread...then I kept reading. Now I am just conf--, I mean, foncused. I will be trying this out when I get the chance, and if I like it enough, MS Paint may be my new IDE. :)
quotes.author: foncused

quotes.quote: I don't know about you, but I've been laughing since he even suggested the idea and still am laughing. I don't think I'll be turning green much anymore with this beautiful IDE around. Heck, with it's amazing error reporting, I'll never even need to get mad at myself for making mistakes anymore. Unlike the individual above me, I can't say that MS Paint will be my new IDE... It already is! I've been using MS Paint since its early stages of development and always will use MS Paint. I've always been a Rubba duckling and I think this project is amazing. I definitely vouch for this IDE and would recommend it over Eclipse, IntelliJ and even Notepad... but I cannot vouch for the sanity of the user after delving into such an amazing application.

messages: Program in an application you already know how to use
Learning how to use an IDE shouldn't be as hard as learning the language
The most partially downloaded IDE on the internet

features.title: Highlighting
features.text: MS Paint IDE comes with the most advanced code highlighting in any production IDE present to this day.

features.title: Clutter free UI
features.text: When programming in MS Paint IDE's base program, MS Paint, you won't find any random useless things like auto competition or a file explorer.

features.title: Parsing
features.text: Top of the line parsing is just standard with MS Paint IDE, providing with sometimes a 99% accuracy reading and parsing your programs.

features.title: Git
features.text: MS Paint IDE has all the essential Git features, including and limited to creating a git repository, adding a remote origin, adding files, and committing/pushing.

features.title: Multiple Classes
features.text: Multiple class support, so you can make as advanced programs as you want.

features.title: Options
features.text: Separate syntax highlighting, compilation, and execution, with the option to do multiple at a time for maximum preformance.

features.title: Fastest Growing
features.text: The fastest growing IDE by our polls, with the most features of any modern day IDE. Since this features section isn't legally binding, we can say that.

advantages.title: Partially Native
advantages.text: The main IDE comes with your Windows computer, so you don't need to worry about potential viruses with your brand new computer.

advantages.title: Popular
advantages.text: Chances are, you probably know about MS Paint, or at least have heard of it. This makes adapting to it easier than most programs.

advantages.title: Oldest
advantages.text: MS Paint IDE's core program, MS Paint, is older than almost every modern IDE, also making it easily recognisable and bug-resistant.

advantages.title: Lightweight
advantages.text: MS Paint IDE is extremely lightweight, and is optimised for Windows systems.

advantages.title: Share Code Easily
advantages.text: Code sharing is easy, as your code is just an image.

advantages.title: Predictable
advantages.text: Everything you see initially in MS Paint IDE is what you get, there's no popup dialogs trying to scare you, different tabs, etc.
